docs.snippet: Was there merit to the parting shot by the hitting coach Dave Hudgens, who after he was dismissed said that fans at Citi Field should be more supportive of Mets hitters?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Was there merit to the parting shot by the hitting coach Dave Hudgens, who after he was dismissed said that fans at Citi Field should be more supportive of Mets hitters?
docs.abstract: Jay Schreiber Keeping Score column examines comments by Dave Hudgens, outgoing hitting coach for the New York Mets, who derided team's fans for being too hard on its hitters; expresses sympathy for fans, noting that they have suffered more losing seasons than most, but says fans are just too tough on team's players at home.

headline.main: A Test for Mets Hitters From the Fans
headline.print_headline: A Test for Mets Hitters From the Fans

docs.snippet: Fatherhood in America has changed over the past few decades. Dads today are more involved in every aspect of child care, from diaper-changing to helping with homework. Nobody questions paternity leave — even Major League Baseball players tak...
docs.lead_paragraph: Fatherhood in America has changed over the past few decades. Dads today are more involved in every aspect of child care, from diaper-changing to helping with homework. Nobody questions paternity leave — even Major League Baseball players take it — and stay-at-home fathers are no longer unusual. And while there are more single moms than ever, kids raised by two parents have a big advantage over kids from single-parent homes: They are less likely to be poor.

headline.main: Photo Essay: What Does Fatherhood Mean to You?
headline.print_headline: Photo Essay: What Does Fatherhood Mean to You?
